coded_answer.p: I have recivedreceived your exitingexciting letter, informing me that I have won two weeks at Camp California in the USA. I will answer your questions in this letter, beginingbeginning with the best momenttime for the Campcampmy visit.
Because of my studystudies I will not be free to travel until julyJuly and schools goesgostart again on in August again so I hope July will be fine.
I much prefer sleeping in tents, it. It seems more friendlyfriendliermore sociable and realyreally sounds like holydaysholidays.
Choosing only two activities infrom such a bunchvariety of interesting ones was quite hard, but I decided to takepick the two I've never tried, Climbing and Surfingclimbing and surfing.
I would like to know what kind of clothes should II should bring and wetherwhether I can wash itthem or not, and I'd like to know how much money will II will need for extras?.

ExcuseForgive me for the long time I left you without any news. I wrote to you last time that I was going to give a handlend a hand forwith the installation and preparation of "Garbage's" concert and you asked me to tell you how it has beenwas.

So one week beforbefore the concert I went atto "L'Arena" to meet the other worker and receive the instructions. I've had the hounourhonour of to helphelping their sound engeineerengineer and branchbranching the cables for microphones, ggitaresguitars etc.

We realyreally started to work like ants the morning beforbefore the show. It was exitingexciting looking at all three mensmen working together and building a scenestage, and it was interrestinginteresting to help the sound engineer to check the sound and configuringconfigure his computers to get the best sound possible.
About two hours beforbefore the beginning of the show, we met the band and recievedreceived tickets to go backstage, that. That was wonderful, maybe better than the concert itself!
And the next morning, I was herethere again to help them foldingfoldput away their stuffsstuff.
Now Kim, tell me about your side of the show.
